conclusion: The graph is a position-time graph with time on the x-axis and position on the y-axis.
The graph is a straight line indicating constant velocity.
A straight line on a position-time graph indicates uniform motion with constant velocity.
At t = 0 s, x = 10 m; at t = 2 s, x = 0 m.
Calculate change in position: Δx = 0 m - 10 m = -10 m.
Calculate change in time: Δt = 2 s - 0 s = 2 s.
Calculate velocity: v = Δx/Δt = -10 m / 2 s = -5 m/s.
Since velocity is constant, acceleration is zero.
The car's acceleration from the start of timing is 0 m/s².
